oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Little Jimmy Dickens Hall of Fame induction - Barbara Mandrell - 1983
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording contains excerpts of a pre-show conversation between Ralph Emery (host) and Ray Charles (performer). Second recording contains an excerpt of Barbara Mandrell (performer) inducting Little Jimmy Dickens (performer) into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 1983.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ralph Emery talks about meeting Ray Charles -- Ray Charles talks about recording Just A Girl I Used To Know, his favorite country song -- Rick talks -- Ray Charles and Ralph talk about George Jones album and the recording Things Have Gone To Pieces -- Ray Charles talks about covering other George Jones tunes -- Ralph and Ray talk about Larry Newton -- Ralph Emery talks about why they are recording this conversation -- Emery asks Ray Charles to do a promo introduction for his radio program -- [break] -- Barbara Mandrell inducts Little Jimmy Dickens into the Country Music Hall of Fame -- [audience applause] -- Little Jimmy Dickens gives his acceptance speech
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Charles, Ray, 1930-2004; Emery, Ralph; Country Music Association (U.S.); Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.); Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-2015; Mandrell, Barbara, 1948-;
